page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This area typifies twentieth century rural Ireland,mixing the old and the new which at the moment don't appear to blend too easily. It is an area of scenic beauty bisected by a stretch of Newry Canal but somewhat marred by the development of private housing. This locality has a marked lack of amenities for which the population depend on surrounding towns. Although picturesque the land is of poor agricultural potential and few make a living from it, those who do engage in sheep farming. Two railway lines transverse the area, one used, the other disused. The former goes straight through as there is no station. The religion of this locality is almost 100% Roman Catholic and there is only one church and graveyard to cater for the district.
